title: Will oxygen gas dissolve in water? - Quora

response.answer_text: It does, albeit not very well (4.95 ml/L in seawater/5.09 ml/L in fresh water at 25 °C) - it’s how fish and some aquatic reptiles can survive in the oceans & rivers - they can extract the dissolved oxygen from the water using their gills. The cooler the water, the more soluble O2 gas becomes (at 0°C, water will hold around 14.5ml/L).
